intro: Sieglingia avenacea, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Sieglingia avenacea is often found in moist, shady environments such as forest floors and stream banks.
